column4: I already have Ubuntu 11.04 installed and apparently I'm supposed to partition my hard drive because the original partition wasn't large enough
I just want to make sure I go and shrink my windows partition without messing anything up
make sure you defrag first
maybe do that  a few times
all right. so I'll defrag and then reinstall?
reinstall windows awesomestman ?
or are you wanting to dual boot and install ubuntu?
reinstall 11.04.
and your partitions are already setup awesomestman ?

i think my partitions are set up. I was able to dual boot yesterday. I have been having issues with software center so I was told to downgrade to 10.04 last night. I didn't know if just reinstalling 11.04 would change anything
I thought it would so I wanted to go with it but when I tried to boot the install from my USB I was told that Ubuntu's partition was too small.

as long as your partitions are already setup awesomestman, you can just go ahead and reinstall, just make sure you don't choose the option to use the whole drive, make sure its just reinstalling on your ubuntu partition (ext4 or whatever)
you want to have at least 5g for your root partition
should I reformat my hard disc beforehand or should I just go with it?
wait, you have windows installed too, yes?
My laptop's off right now and my USB's out
I don't know if my first step is to boot from Windows, 11.04, or from the live USB
like your boot order awesomestman ?
huh?
heh
I was confused by what you just told me
so should I just boot from my USB and reinstall 11.04?
